title: Definitions
context: [ยง587D-1] Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of human services. &ldquo;Emergency services personnel&rdquo; shall have the same meaning as defined in section 78-52. &ldquo;Firefighter&rdquo; means a member of a fire department whose principal duties are to prevent and fight fires. &ldquo;Fire station&rdquo; means a building for fire equipment and firefighters. &ldquo;Health care provider&rdquo; means an individual licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized or permitted by law to provide health care in the ordinary course of business or practice of a profession. &ldquo;Hospital&rdquo; means a facility licensed as a hospital by the department of health and accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations. &ldquo;Police officer&rdquo; means any public servant, whether employed by the State or any county, or by the United States, vested by law with a duty to maintain public order, to make arrests for offenses, or to enforce the criminal laws, whether that duty extends to all offenses or is limited to a specific class of offenses. &ldquo;Police station&rdquo; means a facility where police officers report for assignments, paperwork, and other police business. &ldquo;Unharmed condition&rdquo; means no evidence of injury to a newborn child&rsquo;s physical or psychological health or welfare, as evidenced in any case where: (1) The newborn child is alive and exhibits no: (A) Substantial or multiple skin bruising or any other internal bleeding; (B) Injury to skin causing substantial bleeding; &copy; Malnutrition; (D) Failure to thrive; (E) Burn or burns; (F) Poisoning; (G) Fracture of any bone; (H) Subdural hematoma; (I) Soft tissue swelling; (J) Extreme pain; (K) Extreme mental distress; or (L) Gross degradation; (2) The newborn child has not been the victim of: (A) Sexual contact or conduct, including rape, sodomy, molestation, sexual fondling, or incest; (B) Obscene or pornographic photographing, filming, or depiction; or &copy; Other similar forms of sexual exploitation; (3) Injury does not exist to the psychological capacity of a child as evidenced by a substantial impairment in the child&rsquo;s ability to function; (4) The child has been provided in a timely manner with adequate food, clothing, shelter, psychological care, physical care, medical care, and supervision; or (5) The child has not been provided with dangerous, harmful, or detrimental drugs, as defined by section 712-1240; except in cases where a child&rsquo;s family provides the drugs to the child pursuant to the direction or prescription of a practitioner, as defined in section 712-1240. [L Sp 2007, c 7, pt of ยง2] Revision Note Definitions rearranged pursuant to ยง23G-15.
